item.title: Reddit's plan to kill third-party apps sparks widespread protests
item.description: - Reddit's plan to impose API fees on third-party apps has sparked protests and backlash from users, with hundreds of subreddits planning to go dark for 48 hours on June 12.

item.title: GGML â€“ AI at the Edge
item.description: - GGML is a tensor library for machine learning that enables large models and high performance on regular hardware, and is optimized for Apple Silicon architecture.

item.title: US SEC sues Coinbase, one day after suing Binance
item.description: - The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has filed a lawsuit against cryptocurrency platform Coinbase, accusing it of operating as a middleman on crypto transactions and evading disclosure requirements meant to protect investors.

item.title: Preparing for the Incoming Computer Shopper Tsunami
item.description: - Computer history expert Jason Scott has acquired nearly 200 issues of Computer Shopper, a popular magazine from the 1980s and 1990s that served as a 'bible' of hardware and software.

item.title: OpenGL 3.1 on Asahi Linux
item.description: - Asahi Linux has upgraded its graphics drivers from OpenGL 2.1 to OpenGL 3.1, and increased OpenGL ES 2.0 support to OpenGL ES 3.0.

item.title: Octopuses, crabs & lobsters recognised as sentient beings under UK law (2021)
item.description: - Octopuses, crabs, and lobsters have been recognised as sentient beings under UK law.

item.title: Reddit permanently bans account of user advocating Lemmy migration
item.description: - Reddit has permanently banned a user's account for supporting Lemmy and censoring their posts.

item.title: Apple Vision
item.description: - Apple has announced a new mixed reality headset called Apple Vision, to be released in early 2024 for $3,499.

item.title: US urged to reveal UFO evidence after claim that it has intact alien vehicles
item.description: - A former US intelligence official, David Grusch, has claimed that the US government possesses "intact and partially intact" alien vehicles but is illegally withholding information about them from Congress.

item.title: Nvidia releases new AI chip with 480GB CPU RAM, 96GB GPU RAM
item.description: - Nvidia has released a new AI chip called "Grace Hopper Superchip" designed for large-scale AI and High-Performance Computing (HPC) applications.
